Fellowship Partner Guidelines

At OpenNews, the partners we select to host our Knight-Mozilla Fellows do more than simply offer a desk at their news organization: they are crucial partners who mentor and advise our Fellows as well as offering them access to journalistic problem-sets and experts within their newsrooms.

We look for Fellowship partners who:

  • have a proven track record for innovation
  • place their development team in the newsroom
  • agree to define a problem-space or project that they’d like their Fellow to work on
  • commit to being involved in other OpenNews endeavors, including Code Convenings and Source
  • agree to cover travel costs for a representative to attend the annual Mozilla Festival (twice), a news partner onboarding event at the beginning of the Fellowship period, and at least one other OpenNews-related event while hosting their Fellow
  • are invested in being a leader in the journalism-code community

If you are a newsroom that would like to apply to host a Knight-Mozilla Fellow in 2015, please fill out this form by May 12.

If you want to learn more about how to become involved as a OpenNews Fellowship Partner for 2015, please contact us. We’d love to chat, but please do fill out the form as well. And if being a Fellowship partner doesn’t sound like a fit for your news organization, please check out the other ways OpenNews partners with newsrooms.

The success of OpenNews depends on people like you! Join in:

  • Contribute to Source

Meet the 2015
Knight-Mozilla Fellows

Our 2015 Knight-Mozilla Fellows will hack the news at the Guardian, NPR, the Center for Investigative Reporting, La Nacion, Vox Media, and the New York Times and Washington Post. Learn more about their experience.

About Knight

Knight Foundation supports transformational ideas that promote quality journalism, advance media innovation, engage communities and foster the arts. The foundation believes that democracy thrives when people and communities are informed and engaged.

For more, visit knightfoundation.org

About Mozilla

Mozilla is a global non-profit dedicated to putting you in control of your online experience and shaping the future of the web for the public good—by creating great software and fostering communities that build and grow the open web.

Sign up to hear more, and, if you're willing, please join Mozilla.
